[[Alice Cook (figure skater)|Alice Cook]] |coach= |formercoach= |choreographer= |formerchoreographer= |skating club= Cuyahoga Country Club |retired= }} '''William Benjamin Fauver''' (born March 2, 1954 in [[Cleveland, Ohio]]) is an [[United States|American]] [[pair skater]]. With partner [[Alice Cook (figure skater)|Alice Cook]], he is the 1976 [[United States Figure Skating Championships|U.S. silver medalist]]. They represented the [[United States at the 1976 Winter Olympics]] where [[figure skating at the 1976 Winter Olympics|they placed 12th]]. After several years away from the competitive scene, Fauver returned to competition with new partner [[Lee Ann Miller]]. They are three-time (1981, 1983, 1984) U.S. silver medalists and 1982 bronze medalists. They represented the [[United States at the 1984 Winter Olympics]], where [[figure skating at the 1984 Winter Olympics|they placed 10th]]. ==Competitive highlights== ===Pairs=== (with Patty Morton) {| class="wikitable" |- !
